abstract: Daylong nationwide strike by fast-food and other low-wage workers for $15-an-hour minimum wage may offer first test for Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign at managing voters' and activists' calls for aggressive moves on income inequality; Clinton has offered few details on dealing with economic issue.
lead_paragraph: A nationwide strike may provide the first test for the Clinton campaign at managing the desire of voters and party activists for an aggressive approach to mitigating income inequality.

headline.main: Wage Effort Poses Test for Clinton Campaign
headline.print_headline: Minimum-Wage Effort Tests Clinton on Economic Policy

snippet: A nationwide strike may provide the first test for the Clinton campaign at managing the desire of voters and party activists for an aggressive approach to mitigating income inequality.
